item.title: Sammy_gcpl add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description:
"Quand tu veux construire un bateau, ne commence pas par rassembler du bois, couper des planches et distribuer du travail, mais reveille au sein des hommes le desir de la mer grande et large.
If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people together to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Sammy_gcpl add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Sammy_gcpl add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "In the highest civilization, the book is still the highest delight. He who has once known its satisfactions is provided with a resource against calamity." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sammy_gcpl add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "A wise reader reads the book of genius not with his heart, not so much with his brain, but with his spine. It is there that occurs the telltale tingle..." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Sammy_gcpl add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "The good, the admirable reader identifies himself not with the boy or the girl in the book, but with the mind that conceived and composed that book." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Sammy_gcpl add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Sammy_gcpl add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I write differently from what I speak, I speak differently from what I think, I think differently from the way I ought to think, and so it all proceeds into deepest darkness." -- Franz Kafka
